document.docAuthor: Viloria, Angel L., Pyrcz, Tomasz W. & Orellana, Andrés
document.masterDocTitle: A survey of the Neotropical montane butterflies of the subtribe Pronophilina (Lepidoptera, Nymphalidae) in the Venezuelan Cordillera de la Costa

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A survey of the Neotropical montane butterflies of the subtribe Pronophilina (Lepidoptera, Nymphalidae) in the Venezuelan Cordillera de la Costa

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Pronophila piletha
Hewitson, 1862
: 7
, pl. 3 , fig. 23. 1 male , Venezuela , pur. from Dyson, 47 - 9 BMNH type No. Rh. 3981 [ LECTOTYPE of
Pronophila piletha Hewitson
, herein designated];
1 male
, same data, [ PARALECTOTYPE of
P. piletha Hew.
, herein designated], BMNH .

subSubSection.paragraph: Geographic range: Species: CC; Subspecies: SL in Miranda, Vargas and Aragua States.

Remarks: This species resembles
P. prytanis
and the identification key is given under that species.
P. piletha
is one of the most common species of Pronophilina in the Serranía del Litoral. It occurs above 1400 m and more frequently at 1800–2200 m .
